articles.headline: Stunned Victim Turns Hero
articles.snippet: A 20-year-old summer program gym coordinator played a key role in saving children in a trapped bus.
articles.abstract: A 20-year-old summer program gym coordinator played a key role in saving children in a trapped bus.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 2 — By the time they reached the Interstate 35W bridge, the children on the bus were waterlogged and serene, some still in their bathing suits, ready to go home. It was a rare moment of quiet, and as the bus crossed over the Mississippi River a few of the counselors, barely out of adolescence themselves, had dropped off to sleep in their seats.

articles.headline: At Bridge Site, Search of River Moves Slowly
articles.snippet: Fierce currents and giant, unsteady shards of steel and concrete repeatedly halted rescue attempts for those reported missing and feared dead in Minneapolis.
articles.abstract: Fierce currents and giant, unsteady shards of steel and concrete repeatedly halted rescue attempts for those reported missing and feared dead in Minneapolis.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 2 — A day after the deadly collapse of the most heavily traversed bridge in Minnesota, fierce currents and giant, unsteady shards of steel and concrete slowed divers Thursday in their search of the Mississippi River for people still missing and feared dead.

articles.headline: Without Cash, Instant Profits Were No Help
articles.snippet: Floyd Norris explores American Home Mortgage’s financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Floyd Norris explores American Home Mortgage’s financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The problem faced by American Home Mortgage Investment in the weeks before it collapsed was aptly summarized 134 years ago by Walter Bagehot, the English journalist:

articles.headline: At Hussein Grave, Legend Lives as Fury Simmers
articles.snippet: Saddam Hussein’s burial place, in his native village, offers mixed messages as his legend lives on.
articles.abstract: Saddam Hussein’s burial place, in his native village, offers mixed messages as his legend lives on.
articles.lead_paragraph: AWJA, Iraq — The grave site has a forlorn, even jumbled air. There are filigreed inscriptions hailing him as a martyr, as a hero of the insurgency and as “the eagle of the Arabs,” his favorite sobriquet. But alongside these there is the mundane bric-a-brac of his life — a carved wooden eagle hung with his personal prayer beads, and a gallery of informal photographs, one showing him with a cigar.

articles.headline: American Home Mortgage Says It Will Close
articles.snippet: American Home Mortgage said it would cease most operations on Friday, falling victim to the continuing problems in the mortgage industry.
articles.abstract: American Home Mortgage said it would cease most operations on Friday, falling victim to the continuing problems in the mortgage industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: American Home Mortgage Investment, the troubled mortgage lender based in Melville, N.Y., will close today, making it the latest company to fail this year as loans made to home buyers, some even with solid credit histories, go bad.

articles.headline: Is the Dance Over? Citigroup Is Upbeat
articles.snippet: Citigroup’s C.E.O., Charles O. Prince III, having confronted one crisis after another in his four years leading the bank, thinks the recent Wall Street credit problems are just another bump in the road.
articles.abstract: Citigroup’s C.E.O., Charles O. Prince III, having confronted one crisis after another in his four years leading the bank, thinks the recent Wall Street credit problems are just another bump in the road.
articles.lead_paragraph: Charles O. Prince III cannot catch a break.

articles.headline: Tough Delay for Big Game by Take-Two
articles.snippet: The video game maker said it would delay the release of Grand Theft Auto IV until the second quarter of 2008, likely impacting the entire industry.
articles.abstract: The video game maker said it would delay the release of Grand Theft Auto IV until the second quarter of 2008, likely impacting the entire industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Take-Two Interactive, the video game publisher, said yesterday that it was postponing the release of the latest game in its wildly popular Grand Theft Auto series. The delay is likely to have ripple effects on the broader video game industry during its crucial holiday selling season.

articles.headline: Feeling the Heat, Not Breathing Fire
articles.snippet: China’s high-profile investment in the Blackstone Group has produced an unusual backlash within China as shares in the equity firm have dropped steeply since it went public in June.
articles.abstract: China’s high-profile investment in the Blackstone Group has produced an unusual backlash within China as shares in the equity firm have dropped steeply since it went public in June.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, Aug. 2 — The first purchase by the Chinese government’s new overseas investment fund, a $3 billion stake in the Blackstone Group, has produced an unusual public reaction within China.
